intro: Xylothamia purpusii, commonly known as the yellow nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, with a somewhat succulent texture. Xylothamia purpusii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
